Flying

{1}{B}, {T}: All Zombies gain menace until end of turn.

editions.flavor: The Curse of Wandering leaves only hatred.

name: Lord of the Pit
text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

name: Lord of the Undead
text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor:
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
—Lord Dralnu
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
"I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"
"Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

name: Lord of the Unreal
text: Illusion creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

editions.flavor: "The dream does not end until I say so."

name: Lord of the Void
text:
Flying
Whenever Lord of the Void deals combat damage to a player, exile the top seven cards of that player's library, then put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield under your control.

name: Lord of Tresserhorn
text:
When Lord of Tresserhorn enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life, you sacrifice two creatures, and target opponent draws two cards.
{B}: Regenerate Lord of Tresserhorn.

name: Lore Broker
text: {T}: Each player draws a card, then discards a card.

editions.flavor: Lies are sold as often as truths—and used just as effectively.

name: Lorescale Coatl
text: Whenever you draw a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Lorescale Coatl.

name: Lore Seeker
text: Reveal Lore Seeker as you draft it. After you draft Lore Seeker, you may add a booster pack to the draft. (Your next pick is from that booster pack. Pass it to the next player and it's drafted this draft round.)

editions.flavor: Each volume contains wonders.

name: Loreseeker's Stone
text: {3}, {T}: Draw three cards. This ability costs {1} more to activate for each card in your hand.

editions.flavor: Mages come from far and wide to bathe in its wisdom.

name: Lorthos, the Tidemaker
text: Whenever Lorthos, the Tidemaker attacks, you may pay {8}. If you do, tap up to eight target permanents. Those permanents don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps.

editions.flavor: When Lorthos emerges from his deepwater realm, the tides bow to his will and the coastline cowers in his presence.
When Lorthos emerges from his deepwater realm, the tides bow to his will and the coastline cowers in his presence.

name: Lose Calm
text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste and menace until end of turn. (A creature with menace can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

editions.flavor: A lifetime of discipline forsaken in a moment of rage.

name: Lose Hope
text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Loss
text:
Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Lost Auramancers
text:
Vanishing 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)
When Lost Auramancers dies, if it had no time counters on it, you may search your library for an enchantment card and put it onto the battlefield. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Lost Hours
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player puts that card into his or her library third from the top.

editions.flavor:
"Your thoughts do not interest me nearly as much as the absence thereof."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

name: Lost in a Labyrinth
text: Target creature gets -3/-0 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

editions.flavor: Even those who leave the labyrinth never escape it, forever dreaming of their time trapped within.

name: Lost in the Mist
text: Counter target spell. Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The secrets she carried could have saved many lives, but they quietly drowned with her.

name: Lost in the Woods
text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.

name: Lost in Thought
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. Its controller may exile three cards from his or her graveyard for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.

name: Lost Legacy
text: Name a nonartifact, nonland card. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles his or her library, then draws a card for each card exiled from hand this way.

editions.flavor:
"That name shall not be spoken."
—Baral, Chief of Compliance

text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)

editions.flavor: Mirrans were broken down and rebuilt, made to be loyal servants of the force they had fought.

Lost Order of Jarkeld's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of creatures the chosen player controls.

Flying

{T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: At what price beauty?

name: Lovisa Coldeyes
text: Each creature that's a Barbarian, a Warrior, or a Berserker gets +2/+2 and has haste.

editions.flavor: "A massacre? It is a mercy we grant them. This way they won't freeze to death."
"I lead my horde to the northwest. I won't return until the ice wizards fall and their fiendish contraptions are crushed!"

name: Lowland Basilisk
text: Whenever Lowland Basilisk deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

editions.flavor: Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
Unlike their cousins, Rathi basilisks turn their victims into puddles of flowstone.
"Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

editions.flavor: "I don't know why the little one was so mad. He said to put him down, and I put him down."

First strike

text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

editions.flavor: The loxodon ascribe religious superiority to those born albino, believing them to be spiritually pure.

text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: The gatekeepers are so fastidious that even the winds must wait to pass.

name: Loxodon Mystic
text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

editions.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.
Elder mystics take their vow of silence so seriously that they impose it on any who enter their presence.

name: Loxodon Partisan
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)

editions.flavor:
"On every plane I've encountered loxodons, I've found stalwart and loyal friends."

name: Loxodon Peacekeeper
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, the player with the lowest life total gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper. If two or more players are tied for lowest life total, you choose one of them, and that player gains control of Loxodon Peacekeeper.

text: Loxodon Punisher gets +2/+2 for each Equipment attached to it.

editions.flavor: The loxodons believe punishment comes in two steps: pain and atonement. They carry a weapon for each.

Loxodon Smiter can't be countered.

Vigilance

editions.flavor: Long ago, the Auriok attempted peace with the loxodons. The leonin attempted war. Neither succeeded.

name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
text: Flying

name: Lumengrid Sentinel
text:
Flying
Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may tap target permanent.

editions.flavor: The vedalken order their Neurok sentinels to watch over the shores of the Quicksilver Sea, as if they know of intruders yet to come.
His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.
The wardens keep watch over an endless sea of progress.
The Neurok, like the vedalken, are on a constant quest for knowledge. It is their currency, their trade, their life.

editions.flavor:
"Ludevic saw it in a dream and set to work immediately, every detail already known. Can such genius be taught?"
—Stitcher Geralf

name: Lure
text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

editions.flavor: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.

"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro
It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible.

"When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."
—Maro

"When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait."
—Geyadrone Dihada
Jukai Forest was known for its secrets, which drew in many wayfarers and wizards. But it was those same secrets that kept most of those seekers from ever being heard from again.
Her true theft was to steal the soldiers away from their posts.
Deepwood's reach is not long, so it invites its enemies in.

name: Lurebound Scarecrow
text:
As Lurebound Scarecrow enters the battlefield, choose a color.
When you control no permanents of the chosen color, sacrifice Lurebound Scarecrow.

editions.flavor: It's a fool's race to run if all is lost if it be won.

name: Lure of Prey
text:
Cast Lure of Prey only if an opponent cast a creature spell this turn.
You may put a green creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Lurker
text: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

name: Lurking Arynx
text: Formidable — {2}{G}: Target creature blocks Lurking Arynx this turn if able. Activate this ability only if creatures you control have total power 8 or greater.

editions.flavor: Once it has your scent, it will hunt you from the Gurmag Swamp to Ayagor.

name: Lurking Automaton
text:
Reveal Lurking Automaton as you draft it and note how many cards you've drafted this draft round, including Lurking Automaton.
Lurking Automaton enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the highest number you noted for cards named Lurking Automaton.

name: Lurking Crocodile
text:
Bloodthirst 1 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
